title: Satellogic names former chair of the Pentagon’s joint chiefs Joe Dunford to board of directors
summary: Joseph Dunford, a retired U.S. Marine Corps general and senior managing director of Liberty Strategic Capital, has joined the board of directors of Satellogic.

title: Billionaire plans three more flights with SpaceX, culminating in Starship mission
summary: Jared Isaacman, the billionaire businessman who bankrolled the first human space mission with all private citizens last year, announced plans Monday for up to three more SpaceX missions, a privately-funded program that will include the first commercial spacewalk, and ultimately a ride on the giant Starship rocket ship.

title: India puts three satellites into orbit in the first launch of 2022
summary: India launched three satellites Feb. 14 on its Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle in a rideshare mission marking the nation’s first launch of the year.

title: SpaceX has finally begun filling Starship’s orbital launch site fuel tanks
summary: Almost five months after SpaceX began the process of filling and testing the first custom-built propellant storage system for Starship, the largest...

title: India orbits three satellites in first space launch since failure
summary: An Indian radar satellite and two rideshare payloads rode a Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle into orbit Sunday, returning India’s space program to flight after the failure of a different type of rocket last August.

title: Chinese rocket, not Falcon 9, linked to upper stage on lunar impact trajectory
summary: In a case of celestial mistaken identity, a spent upper stage that will crash on the far side of the moon in March is now linked to a Chinese launch in 2014, not a SpaceX launch of an Earth and space science satellite in 2015, illustrating the difficulties in tracking objects beyond Earth orbit.

title: ISRO launches EOS-04 mission via PSLV-XL
summary: India launched the PSLV-XL rocket for the nation’s first mission of 2022. Following last August’s EOS-03 GSLV launch failure, ISRO returned to flight with the workhorse rocket. For this flight, PSLV will carry the EOS-04 radar Earth observation satellite along with two secondary payloads.

title: Astronomers now say the rocket about to strike the Moon is not a Falcon 9
summary: It's probable that the impact object comes from a Chinese rocket launched in 2014.

title: Lockheed Martin terminates agreement to acquire Aerojet Rocketdyne
summary: Lockheed Martin announced Feb. 13 it has decided to terminate a $4.4 billion deal to acquire rocket engine manufacturer Aerojet Rocketdyne.

title: U.S. intelligence wants to track currently undetectable orbital space debris
summary: The Intelligence Advanced Research Projects Activity in a request for information asks for 'innovative approaches to detect and track currently undetectable orbital space debris'
